label: City or Place Name
rdfs_comment: Name of the city of a location. This element is at the fourth level of a top-down geographical hierarchy.
skos_scopeNote: Optionally, the name of a city or place commonly found in gazetteers (such as a mountain or national park) in which the subjects (e. g., species, habitats, or events) were located.

label: Country Code
rdfs_comment: The ISO code of a country of a location. This element is at the second level of a top-down geographical hierarchy.
skos_scopeNote: The geographic location of the specific entity or entities documented by the media item, expressed through a constrained vocabulary of countries using 2-letter ISO 3166-1 country code (e. g. "IT, SI").
dcterms_description: Accepted exceptions to be used instead of ISO codes are: "Global", "Marine", "Europe", "N-America", "C-America", "S-America", "Africa", "Asia", "Oceania", ATA = "Antarctica", XEU = "European Union", XAR = "Arctic", "ZZZ" = "Unknown country" (3 letter abbreviations from IPTC codes).

label: Country Name
rdfs_comment: The name of a country of a location. This element is at the second level of a top-down geographical hierarchy.
skos_scopeNote: This field can be free text, but where possible, the use of http://iptc.org/std/Iptc4xmpExt/2008-02-29/CountryCode is preferred.

label: Subject Category
rdfs_comment: A term to describe the content of the image by a value from a Controlled Vocabulary.
skos_scopeNote: Controlled vocabulary of subjects to support broad classification of media items. Terms from various controlled vocabularies may be used. AC-recommended vocabularies are preferred and MAY be unqualified literals (not a full URI). For terms from other vocabularies either a precise URI SHOULD be used, or, as long as all unqualified terms in all vocabularies are unique, metadata SHOULD provide the source vocabularies using the Subject Category Vocabulary term. The value SHOULD be a string, whose text can also be in the form of a URL.  These guidelines on value format are less restrictive than is specified by the IPTC guidelines.
dcterms_description: Recommended sets include: the NASA Global Change Master Directory (GCMD; http://gcmd.nasa.gov/), Subject Categories defined in Key to Nature (K2N; http://www.keytonature.eu/wiki/Subject_Category), the BioComplexity Thesaurus; https://www2.usgs.gov/core_science_systems/csas/biocomplexity_thesaurus/, the Description Type GBIF Vocabulary; http://rs.gbif.org/vocabulary/gbif/description_type.xml, the TDWG Species Profile Model; http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems.rdf, the Plinian Core; https://github.com/tdwg/PlinianCore/wiki, the European Environmental Agency GEneral Multilingual Environmental Thesaurus (GEMET; http://www.eionet.europa.eu/gemet), and the Long Term Ecological Research Network Controlled Vocabulary (LTER; http://vocab.lternet.edu/). The vocabulary may include major taxonomic groups (such as "vertebrates" or "fungi") or ecosystem terms ("savannah", "temperate rain forest", "forest fires", "aquatic vertebrates"). Other formal classifications (published in print or online) such as habitat, fuel, invasive species, agroproductivity, fisheries, migratory species etc. are also suitable.

label: Location Created
rdfs_comment: The location the content of the item was created
skos_scopeNote: The location at which the media recording instrument was placed when the media was created.
dcterms_description: The distinction between the location shown and created is often irrelevant, and metadata may be assumed to be referring to location shown. It is recommended that the Location Shown field above always be used when known. However, in the case of position data automatically recorded by the instrument (e. g. EXIF GPS data) Location Created should be used to maintain information accuracy. When one but not both of these locations are present, AC is silent about whether the provided one entails the other. A best practices document for a particular AC implementation might address this.

label: Location Shown
rdfs_comment: A location the content of the item is about. For photos that is a location shown in the image.
skos_scopeNote: The location that is depicted the media content, irrespective of the location at which the resource has been created.

label: Province or State
rdfs_comment: The name of a subregion of a country - a province or state - of a location. This element is at the third level of a top-down geographical hierarchy.
skos_scopeNote: OPTIONALLY, the geographic unit immediately below the country level (individual states in federal countries, provinces, or other administrative units) in which the subject of the media resource (e. g., species, habitats, or events) were located (if such information is available in separate fields).

label: Sublocation
rdfs_comment: Name of a sublocation. This sublocation name could either be the name of a sublocation to a city or the name of a well known location or (natural) monument outside a city. In the sense of a sublocation to a city this element is at the fifth level of a top-down geographical hierarchy.
skos_scopeNote: Free-form text location details of the location of the subjects, down to the village, forest, or geographic feature etc., below the Iptc4xmpExt:City place name, especially information that could not be found in a gazetteer.

label: World Region
rdfs_comment: The name of a world region of a location. This element is at the first (topI) level of a topdown geographical hierarchy.
skos_scopeNote: Name of a world region in some high level classification, such as names for continents, waterbodies, or island groups, whichever is most appropriate. The terms preferably are derived from a controlled vocabulary.
dcterms_description: The equivalent DarwinCore fields here forces primary metadata providers to classify world region terms into separate properties for "continent", "waterbody", "islandGroup". By contrast, the Iptc4xmpExt vocabulary only specifies that a World Region is something at the top of a hierarchy of locations.
